intro: Ononis spinosohircina, commonly known as the spiny hircine ononis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its stems are often spiny, providing a form of mechanical defense against herbivores. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
